body_html: I assumed the OpenCV image (at least the float one) to be continuous, so there was no need for adding strides. In general you have to take them into account and they can be computed with the help of the cv::Mat step. You can't skip the other steps though, because they are due to the order of the dimensions.
body_text:
I assumed the OpenCV image (at least the float one) to be continuous, so
there was no need for adding strides. In general you have to take them into
account and they can be computed with the help of the cv::Mat step. You
can't skip the other steps though, because they are due to the order of the
dimensions.
body:
I assumed the OpenCV image (at least the float one) to be continuous, so
there was no need for adding strides. In general you have to take them into
account and they can be computed with the help of the cv::Mat step. You
can't skip the other steps though, because they are due to the order of the
dimensions.
